definition[0]: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
definition[1]: a piece of special thread which has been used to sew the edges of a wound together
example[0]: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
definition[2]: a sharp pain in the side of your body, which you can get by running or laughing a lot
definition[3]: a small circle of wool that is formed around a needle when you are knitting
note[0]: drop a stitch (=lose a stitch because the wool has come off the needle)
definition[4]: a particular way of sewing or knitting that makes a particular pattern
example[1]: Purl and plain are the two main stitches in knitting.
definition[5]: to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth
example[3]: The jersey has his name stitched across the back.
